attributes.comment:
While I understand the need to equate fees with the cost to complete the
processes they support I have concerns regarding the fees most commonly
associated with international adoption. Due to the slow down in the international
adoption process with many of the countries most commonly utilized there is an
increasing need for most families to refile their I600A and obtain new fingerprints.
As many of these families struggle to come up with the initial fees and travel
expenses associated with international adoption it seems there should be a better
process in which the documents would all expire at the same time. If it was set
that the I171H, the fingerprints and the homestudies all expired at the 24 months
mark like the homestudies in Ohio currently do then many of the families would
not have to refile at all. It is truly unfortunate these families are subjected to having
to file for new fingerprints and I600A forms which consequently then require a
home study renewal even though the home study is not expired at the 12 month
or 18 month time frame that the other documents are expiring. Based on this
alone I think it is unconscionable that an increase in fees is expected even
though for many of the families effected this will be a second filing rather than the
initial.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sheri Blunt
